snippet: The authorities in Turkey have obtained a court order to let them take genetic samples from 21 people questioned in the bludgeoning of Sarai Sierra.
abstract: Authorities in Turkey obtain a court order allowing them to take DNA samples from 21 people who have been questioned in the bludgeoning of Sarai Sierra, Staten Island woman who was found dead in Istanbul after failing to return from vacation.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and CHRISTOPHER MAAG
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The authorities in Turkey have obtained a court order to let them take genetic samples from 21 people questioned in the bludgeoning of Sarai Sierra.

headline.seo: Turks Turn to DNA in Search for Staten Island Woman’s Killer
headline.main: Turks Turn to DNA in Search for Staten Island Woman’s Killer
headline.print_headline: Turks Look for DNA Clues In Killing of S.I. Woman
